company.name: Md7, LLC
company.address: 10590 West Ocean Air Drive, Suite 300, San Diego 92130
company.business_description: Md7, LLC assists wireless operators in managing real estate-related issues.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Md7, LLC, a Delaware company that assists wireless operators with real estate management, published a privacy policy on its website falsely claiming participation in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework. The company stated it complies with the Privacy Shield framework and has certified adherence to its principles, when in fact it had only initiated but never completed the certification application process with the U.S. Department of Commerce. Because Md7 was never certified, its claims of Privacy Shield participation were false and misleading, constituting deceptive acts in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act.

representations_made.description: Claimed to comply with the US-EU Privacy Shield Framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding collection, use, and retention of personal information from EU customers, and that it has certified adherence to Privacy Shield principles
representations_made.quoted_text: Md7, LLC complies with the US-EU Privacy Shield Framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use, and retention of personal information from Individual Customers in the European Union member countries. Md7, LLC has certified that it adheres to the Privacy Shield principles of notice, choice, accountability for onward transfer, security, data integrity and purpose limitation, access, recourse, enforcement and liability. If there is any conflict between the policies in this privacy policy and the Privacy Shield Privacy Principles, regarding the collection, use and retention of personal information from Individual Customers in the European Union member countries, the Privacy Shield Privacy Principles shall govern. To learn more about the Privacy Shield program, and to view our certification page, please visit https://www.privacyshield.gov. . .

representations_made.description: Represented, expressly or by implication, that Md7 is a participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework
representations_made.quoted_text: 12. Through the means described in Paragraph 11, Respondent represents, expressly or by implication, that it is a participant in the EU-U.S Privacy Shield framework.

counts.title: False Claim of EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Participation
counts.representation: Through its website privacy policy, Md7 represented that it complies with the US-EU Privacy Shield Framework, has certified adherence to Privacy Shield principles, and is a participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework
counts.fact: Although Respondent initiated an application to Commerce for Privacy Shield certification, it did not complete the steps necessary to participate in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and was never a certified participant
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 12 is false and misleading, and constitutes a deceptive act or practice in violation of Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act.

definitions.Respondent: Md7, LLC, a limited liability company and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Participation in Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it participates in any government or self-regulatory privacy or security program, including the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory/standard-setting organization, including the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss - U.S. Privacy Shield framework.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order, deliver copies to relevant personnel and business successors, and obtain signed acknowledgments from all recipients.

requirements.description: Within 10 days after the effective date, submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, within 10 days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For 20 years after the issuance date, deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees/agents/representatives with related responsibilities, and any successor business entities; within 10 days for current personnel, and before they assume responsibilities for all others
requirements.quoted_text: B. For twenty (20) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees, agents, and representatives with responsibilities related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in Page 2 of 5 structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt from each individual or entity to whom a copy of the Order was delivered, within 30 days of delivery
requirements.quoted_text: C. From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial sworn compliance report within 60 days and provide timely sworn notices of any changes in contact, structure, or bankruptcy filings.

requirements.description: Within 60 days of the issuance date, submit a sworn compliance report identifying contact information, all businesses, their activities, compliance status for each Order provision, and copies of acknowledgments obtained
requirements.quoted_text: A. Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent’s businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit a sworn compliance notice within 14 days of any change in designated points of contact or in Respondent's structure (including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of any entity subject to this Order)
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within 14 days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of any bankruptcy, insolvency, or similar proceeding filed by or against Respondent within 14 days of its filing
requirements.quoted_text: C. Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within 14 days of its filing.

requirements.description: All sworn submissions must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, including the required declaration language, date, full name, title, and signature
requirements.quoted_text: D. Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: “I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____” and supplying the date, signatory’s full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: All submissions must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier to the Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, FTC, with the subject line beginning: In re Md7, LLC, FTC File No. 1723172
requirements.quoted_text: E. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Page 3 of 5 Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re Md7, LLC, FTC File No. 1723172.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain for five years specific categories of records for twenty years after the issuance date, including accounting records, personnel records, compliance records, and copies of all marketing materials.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold
requirements.quoted_text: A. accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records showing name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title, dates of service, and reason for termination for each person providing services
requirements.quoted_text: B. personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person’s: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of the Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: C. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission; and

requirements.description: Create and retain a copy of each unique advertisement, promotional, or other marketing material making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials relied upon in making the representation
requirements.quoted_text: D. a copy of each unique advertisement, promotional material, or other marketing material making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, interviewing affiliated individuals, and using other lawful investigative means including undercover techniques.

requirements.description: Within 10 days of a written request from a Commission representative, submit additional compliance reports or other requested information (sworn under penalty of perjury) and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and to interview any affiliated individual who has agreed to be interviewed; interviewee may have counsel present
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals, without identification or prior notice, and may use compulsory process under FTC Act Sections 9 and 20
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and will terminate on November 20, 2037, or twenty years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specific exceptions.

requirements.description: Order is final and effective upon publication on the FTC's website (ftc.gov) as a final order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on

requirements.description: Order terminates on November 20, 2037, or twenty years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, with specified exceptions for provisions terminating earlier, non-defendant respondents, and orders already terminated
requirements.quoted_text: publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on November 20, 2037, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order’s application to any Respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision. If such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order as to Respondent will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on November 20, 2037, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any Respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
